pytraj.parallel.map¶

pytraj.parallel.map.map(func, traj, command, dtype='ndarray', *args, **kwd)¶

parallel with MPI (mpi4py)

Examples

$ # create test_radgyr.py file $ cat > test_radgyr.py <<EOF import pytraj as pt from pytraj.parallel import map_mpi from mpi4py import MPI comm = MPI.COMM_WORLD

traj = pt.iterload(‘tz2.nc’, ‘tz2.parm7’)

result_arr = map_mpi(pt.radgyr, traj, “@CA”)

if comm.rank == 0:
# save data to disk to read later by pytraj.read_pickle # pt.to_pickle(result_arr, ‘output.pk’) print(result_arr)

EOF

$ # run in parallel $ mpirun -n 4 python ./test_radgyr.py [array([ 8.10916061, 7.7643485 , 8.09693108, ..., 9.70825678,

9.3161563 , 8.86720964]), array([ 8.82037273, 8.89008289, 9.48540176, ..., 9.29585981, 9.53138062, 9.19155977]), array([ 9.13735723, 8.94651001, 8.97810478, ..., 7.68751186, 8.31361647, 7.83763754]), array([ 7.37423766, 7.05637263, 6.52135566, ..., 6.38061648, 6.24139008, 6.48994552])]
pytraj.parallel.map.map_mpi(func, traj, command, dtype='ndarray', *args, **kwd)¶

parallel with MPI (mpi4py)

Examples

$ # create test_radgyr.py file $ cat > test_radgyr.py <<EOF import pytraj as pt from pytraj.parallel import map_mpi from mpi4py import MPI comm = MPI.COMM_WORLD

traj = pt.iterload(‘tz2.nc’, ‘tz2.parm7’)

result_arr = map_mpi(pt.radgyr, traj, “@CA”)

if comm.rank == 0:
# save data to disk to read later by pytraj.read_pickle # pt.to_pickle(result_arr, ‘output.pk’) print(result_arr)

EOF

$ # run in parallel $ mpirun -n 4 python ./test_radgyr.py [array([ 8.10916061, 7.7643485 , 8.09693108, ..., 9.70825678,

9.3161563 , 8.86720964]), array([ 8.82037273, 8.89008289, 9.48540176, ..., 9.29585981, 9.53138062, 9.19155977]), array([ 9.13735723, 8.94651001, 8.97810478, ..., 7.68751186, 8.31361647, 7.83763754]), array([ 7.37423766, 7.05637263, 6.52135566, ..., 6.38061648, 6.24139008, 6.48994552])]
